Open JIRA search from command line

02 Feb 2016 on bash

In addition to my last post, I made a little bash script for opening the search dialog of a custom JIRA instance from command line. The script works on OS X and opens a new tab in your default browser:

Just put this snippet into your bash.rc or in a seperate bash_alias file. Don’t forget to run source .bash_aliases (or wherever you put it) to make the function available.

Kai Sören Becker

My name is Kai Sören Becker and I’m a web-developer and android enthusiast from Wiesbaden.
